characters.name: Dr. Jonathan Swift
characters.description: Author of A Modest Proposal

characters.name: the Pretender
characters.description: Political figure in Spain that Irish fight for

characters.name: principal gentleman in the county of Cavan
characters.description: Gentleman who informed Swift about children's criminal activities

characters.name: knowing American acquaintance
characters.description: American in London who assured Swift about children as food

characters.name: grave author, eminent French physician
characters.description: French physician who wrote about diet and birth rates

characters.name: worthy person, true lover of his country
characters.description: Friend who suggested refinements to Swift's proposal

characters.name: Psalmanaazor
characters.description: Native of Formosa who came to London and told stories about his country's practices

characters.name: Emperor
characters.description: Emperor of Formosa mentioned in Psalmanaazor's story

characters.name: prime minister of state
characters.description: Minister who bought executed girl's body in Formosa

characters.name: plump girl of fifteen
characters.description: Girl who was crucified for attempting to poison the Emperor in Formosa

characters.name: vintners
characters.description: tavern owners who would prepare the proposed food

characters.name: fine gentlemen
characters.description: wealthy men who value knowledge in good eating

characters.name: skilful cook
characters.description: cook who understands how to oblige guests

characters.name: mothers
characters.description: women who would have increased care for their children

characters.name: married women
characters.description: wives who would compete to bring the fattest child to market

characters.name: men
characters.description: husbands who would become fond of their pregnant wives

characters.name: wives
characters.description: married women during pregnancy

characters.name: Lord Mayor
characters.description: official who would host public feasts

characters.name: reader
characters.description: addressed audience of the proposal

characters.name: women
characters.description: referenced in context of pride, vanity, idleness, and gaming

characters.name: Laplanders
characters.description: inhabitants of Lapland, used for comparison

characters.name: inhabitants of Topinamboo
characters.description: people from Topinamboo, used for comparison

characters.name: Jews
characters.description: historical reference to internal conflict

characters.name: landlords
characters.description: property owners who should show mercy to tenants

characters.name: tenants
characters.description: those who rent from landlords

characters.name: shopkeepers
characters.description: merchants who cheat customers

characters.name: author/narrator
characters.description: the person making the proposal, has no children and wife past child-bearing

characters.name: wise men
characters.description: those who might propose alternative solutions

characters.name: politicians
characters.description: those who might dislike the proposal

characters.name: farmers
characters.description: agricultural workers who are effectively beggars

characters.name: cottagers
characters.description: rural workers who are effectively beggars

characters.name: labourers
characters.description: workers who are effectively beggars

characters.name: narrator's wife
characters.description: the narrator's spouse who is past child-bearing

book_metadata.title: and for making them beneficial to the publick.
book_metadata.author: Dr. Jonathan Swift
